Narrator

As I knelt at the water's edge, my gaze fixed upon the mirrored surface, hoping for clarity amidst the distant echoes of protest resounding incessantly within my mind.

Narrator

With a furrowed brow, I attempted to silence the internal clamor, but the tumult of voices only grew louder.

Player_Romus_Italic

I closed my eyes and took a deep breath to calm my rising frustration.

Take a deep breath.

Player_Romus

"Well, you found me."

Player_Romus

"Forgive me. I didn't hear you come in."

Sal Ignacius

"No need to apologize, Your Majesty."

Sal Ignacius

"I hope I'm not interrupting. Nevertheless..."

Sal Ignacius

"Not necessarily, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

"I appreciate your concern, Sal. Lately, it's been difficult to shake off the unrest plaguing our kingdom -- consuming my thoughts more than I'd like."

Sal Ignacius

"I share your concern, Your Majesty. Regrettably, the grievances they voice are as diverse as the shifting winds of change."

Sal Ignacius

"As am I, Your Majesty. Unfortunately, their concerns vary as wildly as the winds of change."

RiziaDLC.Situation_Welfare_WorkersRights_Horrible == true ||  RiziaDLC.Situation_Welfare_WorkersRights_Bad == true

nan

Sal Ignacius

"As has the lack of affordable housing."

Sal Ignacius

"As has the worsening housing crisis."

RiziaDLC.Situation_Welfare_Housing_LackOfAffordable == true || RiziaDLC.Situation_Welfare_Housing_WorseningCrisis == true || RiziaDLC.Situation_Welfare_WorkersRights_Horrible == true ||  RiziaDLC.Situation_Welfare_WorkersRights_Bad == true

nan

Sal Ignacius

"In addition, inaccessibility to social programs is said to be causing significant hardship, and exacerbating economic disparities, especially for marginalized populations."

Sal Ignacius

"And restrictions on the press, despite their aim to prevent the spread of harmful misinformation, have also stirred significant public discontent."

Sal Ignacius

"The Crown's policy toward Rizia's religious communities hasn't won you any favors either."

!(RiziaDLC.War_Pales_RizianWarSupport < 2\n)

nan

Sal Ignacius

"With all that in mind, I hate to say it, but it isn't all that surprising why Malenyevist revolutionaries are gaining support among the populace."

Sal Ignacius

"But as I was saying, while the unrest we're seeing is certainly troubling, I have faith that God will see us through it."

Player_Romus

"Remind me, how long does their training last?"

"Those are the elite cadets, Your Majesty, known as 'The Devout.'"

Jump to: [Cadet_Hub]

nan

Sal Ignacius

"It would be my pleasure."

Sal Ignacius

"An answer that is staring us right in the face."

!(RiziaDLC.Resources_Budget > 1)

nan

Player_Romus

"The Wruhec's Guardians. They've been doing commendable work thus far, I won't deny that. But deploying them to quell unrest... Are we certain this is the right course of action?"

Player_Romus

"I appreciate your perspective, Sal. But for now, I'm not inclined to deploy the Wruhec's Guardians in this manner."

Sal Ignacius

"Of course, Your Majesty. I will make the necessary preparations to ensure that the Wruhec's Guardians are ready to fulfill their new responsibilities."

Sal Ignacius

"Indeed, Your Majesty. I will ensure that the Wruhec's Guardians are fully prepared to uphold justice and restore order in our kingdom."

Player_Romus

"And I get that. But just because we *can* deploy them doesn't mean that we should."

RiziaDLC.Turn09_ReligionMeeting_GuardiansDeploy = false;

nan

Sal Ignacius

"At the time, you expressed your desire to 'establish a kingdom rigorously governed by the unyielding doctrine of Wruhecism.'"

Player_Romus

"So... just for the sake of curiosity, if I were agree to what you're proposing, how do you envision such a world? Or better question, how do we make that happen?"

RiziaDLC.Trait_ReligiousKing == true 

nan

Player_Romus

"I don't like where this is going but I'm willing to hear you out."

Sal Ignacius

"God be praised! I knew you envisioned this kingdom's future as I do."

Sal Ignacius

"Firstly, as I mentioned the night of the Alignment of the Six Stars, I believe it pertinent that if we're to cement Rizian Wruhecistic principles, the role of Grand Vizier should be given to a religious figurehead -- myself, specifically."

RiziaDLC.Turn06_Briefing_Religion_LeaningWruhecist == true 

nan

Sal Ignacius

"This will not only strengthen the bond between the monarchy and the divine but also foster a sense of righteousness and unity among our people."

Sal Ignacius

"The Guardians, much like myself, would uphold the kingdom's laws with unwavering devotion to the divine principles of Wruhecism. They'd ensure justice free from personal bias or political motivations."

Player_Romus

"Yes, I remember. You'll be pleased to know I'm still open to such a proposal."

Sal Ignacius

"That the advantages of appointing me to such a position would be immense."

Sal Ignacius

"Very well. Moving on..."

Sal Ignacius

"My second proposal would be to take the responsibilities currently bestowed upon the Golden Guard, and give them to the Wruhec's Guardians."

Player_Romus

"Well, it goes without saying that Titus wouldn't be happy about that. However, seeing as how he's my security counselor, I don't see him putting up much of a fuss."

RiziaDLC.Council_Security_Titus == true

nan

!(RiziaDLC.Trait_RebelKing == true)

nan

Sal Ignacius

"Which brings me to my final proposal, this time involving the royal council."

Player_Romus

"I have no intention of supplanting Hugo for you."

Player_Romus

"I'm open to taking such a journey, however, when it comes to replacing Hugo, as I previously said, that's a no-go."

RiziaDLC.Turn09_ReligionMeeting_Sal_AppointGrandVizier = true;

nan

nan

nan

Sal Ignacius

"Without it, we risk straying further from the path of righteousness and forsaking the will of the Divine."

Sal Ignacius

"I see nothing but a bright future ahead of us. Rizia is blessed to have you as our sovereign king."

Narrator

After making his way down, I observed the procession as each cadet approached Sal, who reverently collected the holy water from the sacred pool into a chalice from which to drink.

Player_Romus

"No thanks. But I appreciate the offer."

Player_Romus

"Of course! Just give me clear instructions on what needs to be done."

End();\n\n

Sal Ignacius

"An excellent question I'm more than happy to answer."

Sal Ignacius

"Bless you! I'm so glad you asked."

Sal Ignacius

"It seems our goals are not as in aligned as I thought. If that's the case, and there's no changing your mind otherwise, I will take my leave."

Narrator

The Archsanctuary had actually been built around these canals, embracing their presence in its design.

Narrator

In any case, I was here as a special guest.

Sal Ignacius

"This represents the third graduating class of the Benievon Academy, the most prestigious among them."

Player_Romus_Italic

I stayed silent as the cadets kept filing in.

Say nothing and observe them.

Sal Ignacius

"Firstly, I believe it pertinent that if we're to cement Rizian Wruhecistic principles, the role of Grand Vizier should be given to a religious figurehead -- myself, specifically."

nan

Player_Romus

"I know the position has opened up recently. But I have other candidates in mind."

Sal Ignacius

"What of the Golden Guard's and the Royal Council's replacement?"

Sal Ignacius

"Yes, of course. Then I won't speak of it any longer. Another time perhaps."

Sal Ignacius

"Overall, I'm heartened to hear your acceptance of at least some of my proposals. Though it falls short of the full theocratic reformation I envisioned, it signifies a step forward nonetheless."

Sal Ignacius

"As Grand Vizier, I vow to exceed the expectations placed upon me by both God and the king, ensuring that every task is carried out with utmost diligence and dedication."
